Ekansh Gupta

Ballupur Road · Dehradun, IN 248001 · (+91) 8077331257 · ekanshgupta92@gmail.com

I am a final year student in Mechanical Engineering Department at BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus. I am highly interested in Robotics and I am also exploring areas of Machine learning and computer vision, which might be helpful in robotics.

Projects

Differentiable LOAM

Undergoing Undergraduate Thesis at IIIT Hyderabad under Professor Madhav Krishna. Working on making LOAM differentiable and more robust by assigning weights to each point. I majorly contributed in differentiable pointcloud sampling algorithms, integrating the differentiable ICP algorithm in the pipeline and creating datasets in carla along with neural network implementation for per point weight prediction.

Unmanned Aerial Vehicle

Part of MeitY funded project on "Design and Fabrication of Passenger Drone" in collaboration between IIIT Hyderabad and IIT Hyderabad. Involved in the hardware and software prototyping, integration, testing and development of algorithms for motion planning (global & local) and dynamic obstacle avoidance for pixhawk based quadcopters.


Test flights at IIIT Hyderabad and IIT Hyderabad. As seen, after going to offboard mode, the drone detects an obstacle in Rviz and changes track from the red one by manipulating the control points of the Bspline curve - generating a smooth trajectory.

Autonomous Wheelchair

Product based project funded by IHub-Data for prototyping a VLN based autonomous wheelchair which can be deployed at hospitals or airports. Worked on the hardware implementation along with mapping and localization side of the project by using AMCL and RTABmap.

Video demonstration of the project and its tracking on rviz. In this, we tested the bot's motion through congested door so had to give each waypoint separately.

Autonomous Quadruped

Group project under Team Robocon to create an indigenous quadruped. Received funding of rupees 12 lakhs for the project from BITSAA. This is a long term project for the students to learn and implement concepts that they learn and in the process develop a Level 4 autonomy quadruped project. Other quadruped like Boston Dynamic's Spot rely heavily on kinematics and mechanics, however our work is more in the field of Reinforcement learning so that the bot can learn the complex physics on its own for the various gait patterns. I am currently the head of the project and worked on the gait pattern programming and RL environment and training.

Policy trained in DDPG using Bezier curves as the base policy

Solar panel cleaning bot

Working under Dr Manoj Soni, to create an adaptive solar panel cleaning bot. Recently received a funding of Rs 40,500 to create the prototype. We initially proposed an X-Y core mechanism in MATLAB using simulink but later changed it in the course of time.

Flipkart Grid 2.0

Autonomous hexacopter for Flipkart Grid challenge. The Realsense camera calculates the position of centre coordinate (using OpenCV) of the frame which is then transformed and processed with PID to move to the goal. The frames are placed randomly at a regular interval according to the problem statement. The solution was among the top 5 solutions from all teams in India.

Omnibase maze solver

The robot is an omniwheeled robot and can move in any direction in the X-Y plane and rotate about its axis. RRT algorithm was implemented on this robot to reach the goal coordinate and detect the color of the walls there by using OpenCV.

Path planning algorithms

Implemented basic path planning algorithms in python such as A*, Dijkstra and more along with position estimate filters like GH Filter, Kalman filers, EKF etc

Study Oriented Project

Worked under Dr Jitendra Singh Rathore on the development of artificial skin. We had to test the various mathematical models for skin materials in Ansys, and suggest the most accurate one among them.
